intro: Amauropelta chiriquiana, commonly known as the Chiriquí fern, is a species of tree fern native to Central America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of feathery leaves that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The fronds are used in traditional medicine and are also appreciated for their ornamental value.
